name: synthetic fuel production, from coal, high temperature Fisher-Tropsch operations | ethylene | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20940/documentation

This dataset represents the synthetyc fuels production from coal in South Africa (ZA). These operations are supported by mining coal and converting it into synthetic fuels and chemicals through proprietary Fischer-Tropsch technology by Sasol, the biggest synfuels producer in ZA (and worldwide). Its productions accounts for 150 000 bbl/day of crude-equivalent. ;High Temperature Fisher-Tropsch process makes use of an iron-based catalyst. However no information on catalyst supply or the amount used was available in the public reports.

Activities start with receving the raw coal from the mining sites in the Secunda Complex and the natural gas from imports. Activity includes also on-site waste treatment: incineration of hazardous materials (with residual calorific value) integrated with energy recovery. The High Temperature Fisher-Tropsch process makes use of iron-based catalyst with no other heavy or precious metals included. The public avaible sources don't report informatoin on the amont nor composition of the catalyst.

Acitivities end with the production of major synthetic fuels (petrol, diesel, LPG) via the Fisher-Tropsch technology and natural gas via gas reforming. A comprehensive list of by-products is also provided.
category: C:Manufacturing/19:Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products/192:Manufacture of refined petroleum products/1920:Manufacture of refined petroleum products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: SECUNDA SYFUEL OPERATIONS are  bases in Secunda (South Africa); SSO receives coal from 5 mines in Mpumalanga province. SECUNDA CHEMICAL OPERATIONS operates production facilities in Secunda (SA). Attached figure show the Secunda complex (inclusive of the mining sites) and the operation based in Secunda and Sasolburg.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: SECUNDA SYNFUEL OPERATIONS: Secunda Synfuels Operations operates the world’s only commercial coal-based synthetic fuels manufacturing facility of its kind, producing synthesis gas (syngas) through coal gasification and natural gas reforming. They make use of their proprietary technology to convert syngas into synthetic fuel components, pipeline gas and chemical feedstock for the downstream production of solvents, polymers, comonomers and other chemicals. Primary internal customers are Sasol Chemicals Operations, Sasol Exploration and Production International and other chemical companies. Carbon is produced for the recarburiser, aluminium, electrode and cathodic production markets. ;Secunda Synfuels Operations receives coal from five mines in Mpumalanga (see figure attached). After being crushed, the coal is blended to obtain an even quality distribution. Electricity is generated by both steam and gas and used to gasify the coal at a temperature of 1300°C. This produces syngas from which two types of reactor - circulating fluidised bed and Sasol Advanced SynthoTM reactors – produce components for making synthetic fuels as well as a number of downstream chemicals. Gas water and tar oil streams emanating from the gasification process are refined to produce ammonia and various grades of coke respectively.;SECUNDA CHEMICAL OPERATIONS: The Secunda Chemicals Operations hub forms part of the Southern African Operations and is the consolidation of all the chemical operating facilities in Secunda, along with Site Services activities. The Secunda Chemicals hub produces a diverse range of products that include industrial explosives, fertilisers; polypropylene, ethylene and propylene; solvents (acetone, methyl ethyl ketone (MEK), ethanol, n-Propanol, iso-propanol, SABUTOL-TM, PROPYLOL-TM, mixed C3 and C4 alcohols, mixed C5 and C6 alcohols, High Purity Ethanol, and Ethyl Acetate) as well as the co-monomers, 1-hexene, 1-pentene and 1-octene and detergent alcohol (SafolTM).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data for the APVs (annual production volumes) for the year 2017 have been found in the publics reports above mentioned. These are recordered in the APV specifid field. The RP and by-products have been calculated on the basis of the APVs and rescaled down to 1 kg of petrol, unleaded, low-sulphur.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data are from Sasol reports. Sasol is the biggest synfuels producer in ZA. Its productions accounts for 150 000 bbl/day of crude-equivalent. Data source are:                                                                                           Sasol Integrated Report (2017)                                                                     Sasol Sustainability Report (2017)                                                                    Sasol Performance and Sales metrics (2017)                                               Sasol Additional Analyst information (2017)                                                    Sasol Limited, Form 20-F (2017)

exchanges.description: Ethylene produce;  Sasol Limited, Form 20-F (2017).

flow.name: ethylene
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description: Total coal (41Mt/yr) used both in the processing of the synthetic fuels and to produce electricity (self-generated on site) and steam. Sasol mines underground only. APV 41Mt It include the coal-to-electricity (5,67Mt) and the coal-to-steam (18,48Mt). All the quantinty are on "As Received basis". Sources: Sasol Limited Sustainability report (2017), Sasol Limited, Additional Analyst Information (2017) and Sasolo Limited, Form 20-F (2017).
